Core¶

This city class handles all processing and calculation of metrics for graphs.

class core.City(name, graph)[source]¶

City class; this takes in a graph and the name of the city and calculates all the information for that graph. Each city contains the following fields: name, graphProperties, rawInformation and normalizedInformation. Cities contain an opStatus field in their rawInformation field that indicates whether the graph for that city was processed successfully.

Parameters:
  • name – The name of the city
  • graph – The networkx graph for that city
calcGraphInformation(graph)[source]¶

Calcuates graph metrics for the input graph

Parameters:graph – The graph to process.
Return type:A dictionary containing processed values. One of the calculations is the eigenvector centrality using the power law. If the values for a graph don’t converge in less than 1000 iterations, this operation fails and the city’s opStatus field will be false.
normalizeValues()[source]¶

Normalizes city data information; this is achieved by dividing the rawInformation metrics with the data from the fully connected graph.

processFullyConnectedGraph(nodesInConnGraph)[source]¶

Calculates graph metrics for a full connected graph of size nodesInConnGraph. This is used to normalize values.

Parameters:nodesInConnGraph – The number of nodes the fully connected graph should have.
Return type:A dictionary containing processed values.
processGraphMetrics(graph)[source]¶

Calculates graph metrics like number of nodes and edges, total degree, average degree, connected components and the size of the giant components.

Parameters:graph – the networkx graph for a city
Return type:A dictionary containing processed metrics for the graph
